title: Bug 116744 - Dynamic text content type has no effect
OB: When I set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to any value (Auto, Plain, or HTML), the report displays the same results.
EB:
I expect the report to display different results based on the Content Type property set for the dynamic text element:

- When set to Plain, I expect the literal content (including HTML or RTF tags) to be displayed.
- When set to Auto, I expect content 1, 2, and 3 to appear properly without any HTML or RTF tags.
- When set to HTML, I expect content 1 and 2 to appear properly without any HTML tags, and content 3 to appear literally with RTF tags.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:

1. Create a database field with three types of content:
   a) HTML text within <html>...</html> tag.
   b) HTML fragments not within <html> tag.
   c) Text with RTF tags.
2. Use a dynamic text element in the report to display the contents of this field.
3. Set the Content Type property of the dynamic text element to Auto, Plain, or HTML.
4. Generate and view the report.

Observed Behavior:
- The report always displays the same results, regardless of the Content Type property set for the dynamic text element.

Expected Behavior:
- When the Content Type is set to Plain, the literal content should be displayed.
- When the Content Type is set to Auto, content 1, 2, and 3 should appear properly without any HTML or RTF tags.
- When the Content Type is set to HTML, content 1 and 2 should appear properly without any HTML tags, and content 3 should appear literally with RTF tags.

Please refer to the attached report for more details.
